intro: Leptonychia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered leptonychia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a parsley-like scent when crushed. Leptonychia parviflora is native to parts of Asia and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
